image.altText: artist render of what the proposed development near City Hill would look like

props.synopsis: The site, which is not far from Lake Burley Griffin, will eventually be home to a park, offices, a hotel and 500 apartments.

title.children: Canberra block sold for $66 million to be turned into apartments, hotel

image.altText: canberra city intersection

props.synopsis: ACT police have charged a 15 and a 16-year-old boy after the incident which they allege took place in the early hours of Sunday morning. They are still searching for two others they suspect were involved.

title.children: Teenage boys charged after alleged early morning stabbing in Canberra

image.altText: two men holding a scout drone which is part of a research project for the anu to find new ways to fight fires

props.synopsis: With wildfires raging across Los Angeles, focus is turning to how new technologies, including AI, can aid our response to future disasters,. But there are concerns Australia isn't ready to combat fires all year round.

title.children: Experts warn Australia 'doesn't have tools' to fight large bushfires

image.altText: cannabis grow house

props.synopsis: Police say there are some obvious signs of spotting a grow house — residents coming and going at odd hours, lots of electrical infrastructure, overgrown gardens and blacked out windows — as well as the smell of cannabis.

title.children: 'Huge shock' as neighbour learns of an alleged grow house next door

image.altText: A Localcoin branded Bitcoin ATM.

props.synopsis: There are dozens of cryptocurrency ATMs in the Canberra region, located across the city and outside it — but what are they for, how have they become so prolific, and who uses them?

title.children: Crypto ATMs are multiplying. Here's what they're used for

image.altText: Jacob Vadakkedathu, Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The Liberals lead Senate candidate for Canberra faces a vote to be disendorsed after being called in for a meeting over claims of branch stacking.

title.children: Liberal Senate candidate faces vote to be disendorsed

image.altText: Empty desks on the CommSec trading floor, including social distancing signs

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission found the man, who believed Microsoft Teams amounted to "illegal video surveillance", had not been bullied at work.

title.children: Lawyer who claimed Microsoft Teams was 'illegal video surveillance' has bullying claim rejected

image.altText: Branches on the road after storms tore them down.

props.synopsis: A major clean-up effort is underway across the ACT and surrounds after a severe thunderstorm on Wednesday night pulled down trees, flooded homes and cut power to hundreds of properties.

title.children: Hail 'as big as golf balls' and thunder strikes Canberra with 110kph wind gusts

image.altText: A man in a blue and white checked button down shirt stands in a mechanic's garage full of buses.

props.synopsis: The manufacturer of four electric buses temporarily pulled from Canberra's public service fleet say the ACT government never raised concerns about the vehicles' range despite citing it as a key reason the vehicles were taken off the roads.

title.children: 'No reports of range concerns' in EV buses pulled from Canberra roads

image.altText: Donald Trump in suit pumps fist as crowd looks on

props.synopsis: On the eve of his inauguration, Donald Trump flags "aggressive" border measures and some day one plans at a "victory party" rally in Washington. Look back on the day here.

title.children: Trump says he will repeal 'foolish' orders within hours of taking office

image.altText: Dutton speaks to a Jewish man standing inside a synagogue courtyard.

props.synopsis: Amid a summer of violence against Jewish synagogues and homes, the Coalition vows stronger penalties for acts of anti-Semitism, and repeats its call for a national cabinet to be convened on the issue.

title.children: Coalition vows minimum jail terms for anti-Semitic acts

image.altText: Photo of health service sign

props.synopsis: A group of doctors outraged by last year's abortion ban at Orange hospital in regional NSW say they have lodged a complaint with the state's corruption watchdog.

title.children: 'We are heartbroken and incensed': Doctors demand action after Orange abortion ban

image.altText: A woman with dark hair against a white background

props.synopsis: As the mystery and intrigue deepen, millions of Indians want to know: What hope is there, truly, that Nimisha Priya might be spared?

title.children: An Indian nurse killed a man in Yemen. His family will determine her fate

image.altText: A woman in a red hat leaning on a rusty bar of a gate.

props.synopsis: Think you earn a decent salary? The latest inequality report from Oxfam found Australia's billionaires took home 1,300 times more than the average Aussie earner last year.

title.children: Australian billionaires made $67,000 an hour last year, report finds

image.altText: Novak Djokovic fires up the Serbian fans at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: The Serbian Council of Australia is calling for the resignation of Nine presenter Tony Jones after his comments to fans about Novak Djokovic at the Australian Open. Follow live.

title.children: Former Aus Open champ says Djokovic's skin 'a little thin' but he's earned respect

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment shares fall in early trade as the casino operator continues to seek a financial lifeline, while the broader market heads higher. Trump launches a meme coin ahead of his inauguration. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Star warns investors of 'material uncertainty', ASX rises

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Mr and Mrs Trump's meme coin fortunes
ASX 200 up 0.3pc, lifted by miners and banks

image.altText: A man about to put a coin into a white piggy bank with other stacks of coins sitting next to the piggy bank

props.synopsis: The federal government should intervene to help retirees spend their superannuation and avoid the savings system ending up as "a massive inheritance scheme", the Grattan Institute warns.

title.children: Australian retirees sitting on their super rather than spending it

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A woman cries in front of a car.

props.synopsis: Two leading lawyers and a juror reveal what goes on behind the scenes of a high-profile murder trial, as Victoria's Supreme Court prepares for the Erin Patterson triple-murder case later this year.

title.children: 'Did she do it?': Jurors to answer key question of the mushroom cook case

image.altText: Close up of flat white in coffee cup with $5.50 in change

props.synopsis: Industry insiders say coffee lovers — even in regional Australia — are unlikely to escape paying more for their flat whites as cafes are forced to push up prices.

title.children: Flat white price likely to skyrocket this year, no matter where you live

image.altText: A flooded roadway in the Pilbara

props.synopsis: Severe Tropical Cyclone Sean is upgraded to a category three system off the coast of Western Australia as it impacts residents in the state's far north.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Sean drops 20-year record rain, cutting off towns by road

image.altText: Two young Afghan girls sit at a wooden desk, one writing with a pen and one reading.

props.synopsis: In a rare public rebuke, the foreign ministry deputy calls on the Taliban's leadership to end the ban on education for Afghan women and girls.

title.children: Senior Taliban official urges reversal of education ban on Afghan girls

image.altText: A rusted out shipwreck in the ocean with a small island in the background

props.synopsis: HMAS Protector, crumbling offshore of Heron Island, played an important part in Australia's naval history and is now a marine paradise providing security for fish, turtles, rays, and sharks.

title.children: HMAS Protector, bought for just 10 pounds, now a marine paradise off Heron Island

image.altText: A big red-brown rock in front of a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in western Victoria say a draft management plan for Mt Arapiles-Tooan State Park has re-ignited racial abuse and harassment of Aboriginal people online and in the community.

title.children: Aboriginal people say Mt Arapiles climbing ban has sparked racist backlash

image.altText: Aerial photo of a group of people by a river.

props.synopsis: Protesters call for a shake-up of Western Australia's fire management practice, but others point to the tragic outcomes of the Los Angeles fires as a cautionary tale.

title.children: Protest calls for end to prescribed burns in old-growth forests

image.altText: Shot of teenage boy in park in front of tree

props.synopsis: Kian Guerreiro’s family thought his crushing fatigue was due to puberty. They never imagined the active teenager was fighting off melioidosis.

title.children: A deadly bacteria found in dirt almost claimed teen's life

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz looks annoyed, holding his head in his hands with a towel

props.synopsis: The US ban of TikTok has some feeling glum, while a hot-temper in the Aussie heat has burnt a hole in Medvedev's pocket. Here are the five quick hits from day eight of the Australian Open.

title.children: Quick hits: 'Crazy' clocks, TikTok turmoil and racquet smashing fines

image.altText: A woman holds a hot water bottle against her stomach.

props.synopsis: A new study has found almost four in five Australian women have experienced problematic periods in the past five years, and almost half of those have missed days of work or study, costing about $14 billion a year in lost productivity.

title.children: Periods in spotlight as research highlights personal and economic cost

image.altText: Alex de Minaur looks on during his Australian Open third round match.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur is bidding to reach his first Australian Open quarterfinal, however, talented Alex Michelsen isn't going to make his assignment easy.

title.children: De Minaur aiming for Aus Open first but lanky American stands in his way

image.altText: A sign that reads "Maryborough Court House" in front of an old building.

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old Maryborough man has been charged with attempted murder after a 43-year-old man was found with a gunshot wound to the head last week.

title.children: 3D-printed gun recovered as attempted murder accused faces court in Queensland

image.altText: A smiling woman leans on fishing nets in a shed.

props.synopsis: Queensland's most valuable wild-caught fishery is collaborating with conservationists and governments to improve environmental practices and reduce bycatch.

title.children: Big environmental improvements for wild-caught prawn industry

image.altText: Generic blue and white NSW Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with the murder of a 48-year-old man who was found critically injured at a unit in Sydney's north-west.

title.children: Man charged with murdering another man in Sydney's north-west

image.altText: Teacher Georgia Rowe stands in her classroom holding a sign which says, welcome to 5/6 with Miss Rowe.

props.synopsis: Ahead of a return to school, the union says the teacher shortage is a crisis that still spans across Queensland.

title.children: Large regional cities miss out on incentives to attract teachers

image.altText: Elderly lady and man with a beard, sitting at bench with a cup of tea and ipad, looking at camera

props.synopsis: Ageing boomers, a nursing shortage, and a federal capital works system labelled as a "lottery" are forcing some older residents to separate from their families, some regional aged care providers say.

title.children: Aged care residents forced to find a bed hundreds of kilometres away from home

image.altText: Zoe Saldana and Karla Sofía Gascón stare at each other while standing near a red curtain.

props.synopsis: Starring Selena Gomez and Zoe Saldana, this musical telenovela about a trans cartel kingpin was a hit at Cannes and has already won a Golden Globe. So why is it copping so much criticism elsewhere?

title.children: Emilia Perez is a star-studded Oscars favourite but it's also proving controversial
